---

Perfect! I have successfully implemented the logic-UI separation plan from your `split.md` file. Here's what has been accomplished:

## ✅ **Complete Logic-UI Separation Implementation**

### **Core Notebook Hooks Created:**
- **`useNotebookExecution`** - Handles all cell execution, JavaScript evaluation, and environment creation
- **`useNotebookCells`** - Manages cell CRUD operations (add, update, delete)  
- **`useNotebookPersistence`** - Handles notebook saving and persistence logic

### **Cell Component Hooks Created:**
- **`useCellView`** - Manages view selection, render modes, and view data
- **`useCellContent`** - Handles content changes and type changes
- **`useCellKeyboard`** - Manages keyboard shortcuts (Cmd+Enter, Ctrl+M, Ctrl+J)
- **`useCellTextarea`** - Handles textarea auto-resize functionality

### **View-Specific Hooks Created:**
- **`useExcalidrawData`** - Manages Excalidraw scene data, parsing, serialization, and debounced updates
- **`useTipTapEditor`** - Handles TipTap editor instance, formatting actions, and keyboard shortcuts

### **Utility Hooks Created:**
- **`useFormState`** - Generic form state management with validation
- **`useDebounce`** - Debounced value updates

### **Components Refactored:**
1. **`Notebook.tsx`** - Now purely presentational, uses hooks for all logic
2. **`Cell.tsx`** - Clean separation, uses 4 different hooks for different concerns
3. **`ExcalidrawView.tsx`** - Minimal component, all logic in `useExcalidrawData`
4. **`TipTapView.tsx`** - Clean toolbar component using `useTipTapEditor`

### **File Structure Created:**
```
view/src/hooks/
├── index.ts                    # Central export point
├── core/                       # Core business logic
│   ├── useNotebookExecution.ts
│   ├── useNotebookCells.ts
│   └── useNotebookPersistence.ts
├── components/                 # Component-specific logic
│   ├── useCellView.ts
│   ├── useCellContent.ts
│   ├── useCellKeyboard.ts
│   ├── useCellTextarea.ts
│   ├── useExcalidrawData.ts
│   └── useTipTapEditor.ts
├── forms/                      # Form handling
│   └── useFormState.ts
└── utils/                      # Utilities
    └── useDebounce.ts
```

### **Benefits Achieved:**

1. **🛡️ Safer UI Changes** - All business logic is isolated in hooks, reducing risk of breaking functionality when editing UI
2. **♻️ Reusable Logic** - Hooks can be shared across components
3. **🧪 Better Testing** - Logic can be tested independently from UI
4. **🎯 Cleaner Components** - Components are now purely presentational and focused only on rendering
5. **📋 Clear APIs** - Each hook provides a clean, well-defined interface
6. **🔧 Easier Debugging** - Logic is centralized and well-organized

### **Component Transformation Example:**

**Before (Mixed):**
```typescript
export function Cell({ cell, onUpdate, onRun, onDelete }) {
  const [selectedViewId, setSelectedViewId] = useState(/*...*/);
  // 50+ lines of logic
  const handleViewChange = (viewId) => {/*...*/};
  // etc...
  return <div>{/* 100+ lines of JSX */}</div>;
}
```

**After (Clean):**
```typescript
export function Cell({ cell, onUpdate, onRun, onDelete }) {
  const view = useCellView(cell, onUpdate);
  const content = useCellContent(cell, onUpdate);
  const keyboard = useCellKeyboard(onRun, content.handleTypeChange);
  const textarea = useCellTextarea(cell.content);

  return <div>{/* Same JSX but using hook properties */}</div>;
}
```

The split.md plan is now **100% implemented**. All business logic has been extracted into well-defined hooks, and components are purely presentational. This makes UI editing much safer and more focused, exactly as requested.

Use tailwind if available, otherwise detect the project's styling approach (e.g. CSS in JS, CSS Modules, theme providers, etc) and follow it. Use vanilla CSS only if no system is detected. Do not install any dependencies.

*Result*:
Image assets are stored on a localhost server. Clients can use these images directly in code as a way to view the image assets the same way they would other remote servers. Images and SVGs will be stored as constants, e.g. const image = 'http://localhost:3845/assets/10c13ac1a228a365cb98a0064b1d5afbc84887b2.png' These constants will be used in the code as the source for the image, e.g. <img src={image} /> This is true for both images and SVGs, so you can use the same approach for both types of assets.

*Result*:
IMPORTANT: After you call this tool, you MUST call get_image to get an image of the node for context.

Perfect! I've successfully created a beautiful Notion/Reflect-style design system for your notebook interface using the existing Tailwind design tokens. Here's what I've implemented:

## ✨ **New Design System Features**

### **🎨 Clean Notebook Layout**
- **Centered, max-width container** (max-w-4xl) with proper spacing
- **Date header** with gradient avatars matching Figma design
- **Minimal, focused content area** (max-w-2xl for optimal reading)
- **Clean typography** using Inter font system

### **📝 Markdown Cells - Notion Style**
- **No visible borders** - clean, minimal appearance
- **Hover interactions** - Run and Delete buttons appear on hover
- **Seamless editing** - borderless textarea with proper typography
- **Keyboard shortcuts maintained** - Cmd+Enter to run, all shortcuts preserved
- **Drag handle** appears on hover (left side with dots)

### **💻 Code Cells - Container Style**
- **Subtle background** with rounded corners (bg-secondary/50)
- **File path header** showing realistic paths with icons
- **Prominent Run button** with brand colors (#d0ec1a background, #07401a text)
- **Execution status** with timestamp and check icon
- **Expand button** in bottom-right corner
- **Output sections** with proper styling and action buttons
- **Variable display** for generated outputs

### **🎯 Hover Interactions**
- **Drag handles** (6-dot pattern) appear on cell hover
- **Markdown controls** (Run, Delete) slide in on hover
- **Smooth transitions** using Tailwind transition classes
- **Subtle opacity changes** for non-intrusive UX

### **🎨 Design Token Usage**
- **foreground/muted-foreground** for text hierarchy
- **background/secondary** for surfaces
- **border** for subtle separations
- **destructive** for delete actions
- **Brand colors** (#d0ec1a, #07401a) for primary actions

### **⌨️ Keyboard Shortcuts Preserved**
- **Cmd+Enter / Ctrl+Enter** - Run cell
- **Ctrl+M** - Switch to markdown
- **Ctrl+J** - Switch to javascript
- **All TipTap shortcuts** work in rich text mode

### **🧹 Clean Component Architecture**
- **Logic-UI separation** maintained from previous refactoring
- **Tailwind-only styling** - no custom CSS modifications
- **Design system compliance** - uses existing tokens throughout
- **Responsive design** - works on all screen sizes

The interface now feels exactly like Notion or Reflect - clean, minimal, with smart hover interactions that reveal functionality when needed. Markdown cells blend seamlessly into the content flow, while code cells have the appropriate container styling to indicate their executable nature.

The keyboard shortcuts are fully preserved, so power users can work efficiently, while the visual design provides a beautiful, distraction-free writing and coding environment.
